definition_en: Are the descendants of the original inhabitants of North America. Under the Constitution Act, 1982 the Aboriginal peoples of Canada include the Indian, Inuit and Métis peoples of Canada. These Aboriginal peoples have unique heritages, cultural practices and spiritual beliefs. Indians (now generally known as First Nation) are descendants from the various tribes that occupied what is now Canada prior to the arrival of Europeans. As a result of the Indian Act, First Nation people may be referred to as status or non-status Indians. Indians who are beneficiaries under a treaty may be referred to as treaty Indians. Inuit are descendants of the original inhabitants of Northern Canada including what is now known as Nunavut, Northwest Territories, Northern Quebec and Northern Labrador. Métis are Aboriginal people of mixed Aboriginal and European ancestry who identify themselves uniquely as Métis.
usage_context: When drafting the new policy, it is important to consult with Aboriginal people to ensure their perspectives are included.
common_trap: The term "Indian" is outdated and can be offensive. It is better to use "First Nation" or the specific name of the nation.

definition_en: Is a request for access to a record made under the Access to Information Act.
usage_context: I submitted an access request to get a copy of the report.
common_trap: An access request is not the same as a privacy request, which is made under the Privacy Act.

definition_en: A sum of money advanced to a person from an appropriation; and a sum of money advanced to a person from the sum of money described in paragraph a) for which the person is accountable and includes imprest funds and working capital advances administered under an imprest system.
usage_context: I received an accountable advance to cover my travel expenses for the conference.
common_trap: An accountable advance must be accounted for with receipts and any unused funds must be returned.

definition_en: A credit card issued under a contract between card issuers and the Government of Canada for the procurement and the payment of goods and services that are authorized official government business transactions.
usage_context: I used my acquisition card to purchase the new office supplies.
common_trap: The acquisition card can only be used for authorized government purchases.

definition_en: an employee organization that is certified by the PSSRB as the bargaining agent for the employees in a bargaining unit and is empowered to enter into a collective agreement with the employer.
usage_context: The union is the bargaining agent for all employees in this classification.
common_trap: The bargaining agent represents the employees, not the employer.

definition_en: a group of employees that the PSSRB has determined to constitute a unit of employees appropriate for collective bargaining.
usage_context: All employees in the administrative support category are part of the same bargaining unit.
common_trap: A bargaining unit is not the same as a work unit or team.

term_fr: personne nommée à titre de travailleur occasionnel
definition_en: Is a person employed on a casual basis pursuant to the Public Service Employment Act.
usage_context: We hired a casual worker to help with the increased workload during the summer.
common_trap: A casual worker is not a term employee and does not have the same benefits.

term_fr: organismes de services centraux et communs
definition_en: Common service organizations are listed in Appendix B of the Common Services Policy. The Privy Council Office, the Department of Finance and Shared Services Canada are also central agencies for the purposes of this policy.
usage_context: Shared Services Canada is a central and common services agency that provides IT services to other government departments.
common_trap: Not all shared services are provided by a central and common services agency.

definition_en: Is an activity involving the comparison of personal information from different sources, including sources within the same government institution, for administrative or non-administrative purposes. The data-matching activity that is established can be systematic or recurring. The data-matching activity can also be conducted on a periodic basis when deemed necessary. Under this policy, data matching includes the disclosure or sharing of personal information with another organization for data-matching purposes.
usage_context: The agency uses data matching to verify the eligibility of applicants for the program.
common_trap: Data matching must be done in accordance with the Privacy Act.

definition_en: Is an officer or employee of a government institution who has been delegated to exercise or perform the powers, duties and functions of the head of the institution or the Act.
usage_context: The director is the delegate for all financial decisions under $10,000.
common_trap: A delegate can only exercise the powers that have been specifically delegated to them.

definition_en: The impact of a program, policy or other entity, or the extent to which it is achieving its expected outcomes.
usage_context: We need to measure the effectiveness of the new training program.
common_trap: Effectiveness is not the same as efficiency. Effectiveness is about doing the right things, while efficiency is about doing things right.

definition_en: The extent to which resources are used such that a greater level of output/outcome is produced with the same level of input or, a lower level of input is used to produce the same level of output/outcome. The level of input and output/outcome could be increases or decreases in quantity, quality, or both.
usage_context: We are always looking for ways to improve the efficiency of our processes.
common_trap: Efficiency is not the same as effectiveness. A process can be efficient but not effective if it does not produce the desired results.
